Service

PROCEDURE :
Cadaveric pancreas transplantation .
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS
The patient is a 37 year old lady with type 1 diabetes mellitus , who is four months postcadaveric kidney transplantation and now has good graft function .
She presents for cadaveric pancreas transplantation .
Her diabetes mellitus has been complicated by retinopathy and nephropathy as well as peripheral neuropathy .
She takes 14 units of NPH insulin twice a day supplementing with a sliding scale .
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION
On examination , she is in no apparent distress and is alert and oriented .
Her chest and cardiovascular examinations are unremarkable .
She is afebrile with stable vital signs .
Her abdomen is soft and nontender with a well healed left lower quadrant incision from her kidney transplantation .
She has good femoral pulses bilaterally .
HOSPITAL COURSE
She underwent cadaveric pancreas transplantation without complication .
She received induction therapy with thymoglobulin intraoperative and postoperatively for five days .
She was kept on a similar immunosuppressive regimen as with her kidney transplant .
She had excellent pancreas graft function immediately .
Her renal function also remained stable in the perioperative period .
She was quickly placed on a diet and advanced to regular diet .
She was discharged home in stable condition on postoperative day six .
CONDITION ON DISCHARGE
Stable .
DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS
She will begin weekly follow-up in the Transplant Center .
She is to not lift anything greater than ten pounds for six weeks .
She is to continue monitoring her blood sugar twice a day .
She has undergone full teaching in regards to immunosuppressant medications .
In addition , she will take Valganciclovir for three months posttransplant .
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES
1. Status post cadaveric pancreas transplant .
2. Type 1 diabetes mellitus .
3. End stage renal disease , status post kidney transplantation .
